text: Atkinson Alfred Patrick Tighe (1827 - 13 June 1905) was an Australian politician. He was born at sea near Corfu to Sergeant Robert Tighe of the 17th Regiment. He arrived in New South Wales around 1830, and by 1840 his father was chief constable and a publican at Newcastle. The younger Tighe established a slaughterhouse, and on 14 July 1859 married Arabella Vine, with whom he had seven children. A Newcastle alderman from 1859 to 1862 and from 1871 to 1873, he served as mayor from 1872 to 1873. In 1862 he was elected to the New South Wales Legislative Assembly for Northumberland, serving until 1869. During this period he served for a month (September - October 1868) as Postmaster-General. In 1873 he was appointed local coroner at Newcastle, and he was a police magistrate from 1874 to 1878. He returned to the Assembly in 1882 but resigned in 1884. Tighe died at Glebe Point in 1905. ==References== Category:1827 births Category:1905 deaths Category:Members of the New South Wales Legislative Assembly Category:19th-century Australian politicians Category:Mayors and Lord Mayors of Newcastle
